newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Davao finalises terms for preferred shares.
newsitem.headline: Davao finalises terms for preferred shares.

text.p: Davao Union Cement Corp said on Monday it would offer 1.25 billion pesos worth of new preferred shares in three tranches.
The new preferred shares are to partly cover for the increase in its authorised capital to three billion pesos from two billion.
The first tranche, which would raise 250 million pesos, had been issued at par value of one peso per share this month.
The non-convertible and non-voting preferred shares can be redeemed within one year from the issue date, the company told the Philippine Stock Exchange.
Dividends will be equal to 90 percent of the 91-day Treasury bills plus 62.5 basis points.
Payments shall be on a monthly basis or any other payment agreement betwen the issuer and the issue manager.
The second tranche, which covers 500 million pesos, would be issued next month; while the third tranche, another 500 million pesos worth, will be in the second half of the year.
The second and third tranches carry the same terms.
They are redeemable after two and a half years from the issue date of the second tranche. The shares, which have a par value of one peso each, would be issued at 100 pesos apiece.
Davao Union is one of the cement subsidiaries of Bacnotan Consolidated Inc.
